Mystery! People seem to be more often sick!  And it’s not free 😮The Swiss have universal healthcare. The costs are shared equally among all citizens, with basic health services covered after a self-pay minimum of around $2000 per year. That's fine. But since the end of the #pandemic in 2021, people seem to need more services. This year costs are rising by ~10%, last year by 6.3%.https://www.srf.ch/news/schweiz/krankenkassenpraemien-praemienhammer-krankenkassen-wollen-8-bis-9-prozent-rauf#economy #mystery #covid #universalhealthcare

Not sure if this will actually happen, but if it does it would be a massive game changer. So far it has 23 sponsors in the Michigan House, which is more than I would have expected.Rep. Carrie Rheingans introduces bill that would establish universal healthcare in MichiganRep. Carrie Rheingans (D-Ann Arbor) has introduced a bill that would create a publicly funded health system that would provide comprehensive services in Michigan.House Bill 4893 would establish a universal healthcare system and reform the current payment system for healthcare coverage in Michigan. It would utilize both private and public providers to offer physical, dental, and mental healthcare without deductibles, copays, or premiums.Rheingans told State of Reform she is still considering options to fund her proposal for Michigan, but plans to utilize MICare, which all residents would be eligible for. It would include coverage provided under Medicaid, Medicare, MIChild (the state’s child health plan under Title XXI of the Social Security Act), employers that choose to participate, and state and government employees.#USPol #Politics #Michigan #UniversalHealthCare #SinglePayerHealthCare #HealthCare #Democrats #MIPolitics #MedicareForAll https://stateofreform.com/featured/2023/09/rep-carrie-rheingans-introduces-bill-that-would-establish-universal-healthcare-in-michigan/

@QasimRashid Since you are running for Congress, I have a sincere question for you:What are the top 3 most effective tactics Americans can employ right now to further the goal of universal, single-payer healthcare?We have Medicare For All on the table in both the House and Senate. Badgering our bought-off representatives has proven futile. I work with universal healthcare advocacy orgs on both the state and national levels, and, often, we are at a loss as to where our *very* limited resources would best be spent. Sometimes, I feel like making a sign, standing in front of the hospital day after day, shouting about the insanity of our system would be my best use of time. P.S. I don't live in your jurisdiction, but I hope you win. #Healthcare #HealthCareIsAHumanRight #USPol #USPolitics #MedicareForAll #Medicare4All #PeopleOverProfit #GetProfitOutOfHealthcare #AbolishMedicareAdvantage #BanACOREACH
